description:
Happy 1st April! This means that… Our Virtual Flag Day 2022 is here! (And no, it’s not an April Fool’s joke 👻)
 
For the last 70 years, many of you have helped Singapore Children’s Society make a difference to the lives of our beneficiaries, and we can’t thank you enough.
Every donation you make will help us reach out to those in need, and enable our professional staff at our service centres islandwide to continue providing care and support to our beneficiaries.
 
Please continue to support our cause & drop an e-token of love this Virtual Flag Day!
Be a part of the reason why their bucket is full of hope today 😊
 
Donate & find out more through the link in our bio: @sgchildrensoc 
 
#flagday2022 #fundraising #charity #givingback #donatetoday

description:
👀 Take a peep into #adayinthelife of a youth worker as Ms Izyan from @jyc_at_scs takes us through her day! It was also a special one as our youth members were recording their performances for our recent 1000 Enterprises for Children-in-Need and 1000 Philanthropists Appreciation Event. Opportunities like this engages our youth meaningfully, develops their strengths and builds their self-confidence.
 
Watch till the end for a mini surprise! (Hint: TikTok dances 👯)
 
#adayinmylife #youthwork #youthworker #sgchildrensoc

description:
Singapore Children’s Society held the 1000 Enterprises for Children-in-Need (1000E) & 1000 Philanthropists (1000P) Appreciation Event 2022 yesterday at PARKROYAL on Beach Road ✨ This event allows us to recognise the generous enterprises & philanthropists who supported the programmes in 2021.
 
It was our honour to have Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for National Security, Mr Teo Chee Hean, who is the Patron for the 1000E and 1000P programmes as our Guest-of-Honour. SM Teo presented certificates to 40 donors who attended the event onsite.
 
We are truly grateful for the support we’ve received in helping us further our mission of bringing relief and happiness to children in need 😊
 
To join the programmes & find out more, visit: 
https://www.1000e.org.sg/ (#linkinbio @sgchildrensoc)
https://www.1000p.org.sg/ (#linkinbio @sgchildrensoc)
 
#fundraising #charity #givingback #donatetoday

description:
Today is World Water Day. To raise awareness about water conservation, our youth beneficiaries from JYC @ Children’s Society teamed up with senior rowers from SG Dragons to clean up Lower Seletar Reservoir on 16 March. As Dan Wen, one of our beneficiaries who took part in the cleanup, put it : “I had a lot of fun during the kayaking and cleanup…I feel happy to not only enjoy myself during the event but also helping the environment’. Thanks to the organisers Camelot Singapore and PUB for giving our beneficiaries the chance to be a part of this meaningful event. Read the article through the link in our bio @sgchildrensoc 

#makeeverydropcount #goblue4SG  @pubsingapore @jyc_at_scs
labels_str: person human toy monitor electronics screen display

description:
“Hello, I’m Tinkle Friend! What would you like to talk about today?”

Do you enjoy chatting with children? Are you able to listen and empathise with others? We are currently recruiting volunteers to man our Tinkle Friend helpline and online chat for primary school children in Singapore! Tinkle Friend volunteers offer a listening ear to children who call in or chat with us online about their issues and concerns.

If you are 21 years old and above and keen to be a Tinkle Friend volunteer, you can find out more and register through the link in our bio @sgchildrensoc

Please contact the Tinkle Friend team at 6276 5077 from Monday to Friday, 8.30am to 5.30pm and/or email us at tinklefriend@childrensociety.org.sg if you have any queries about the volunteering opportunity.

We hope to welcome you into our Tinkle Friend family 😊

#tinklefriend #sgvolunteer

description:
It is World Social Work Day today! We invited Ms Tan Bee Joo, Senior Director and Group Lead of Family Services to share more about her 24-year journey with Singapore Children’s Society.
 
In her starting years, she was involved with casework and counselling for low-income families and had also worked with youth in Project CABIN – drop-in centres in secondary schools for students to have a conducive environment to hangout after school hours. She led projects such as the Bully Free programme and Tinkle Friend as she took on a managerial role, and today, she continues to serve vulnerable families and their children in the Yishun community.
 
Swipe to see some of the many memorable moments Bee Joo hold close to her heart 💖. She also shared her hopes for Children’s Society as it marks its 70th anniversary this year.
 
From the bottom of our hearts, thank you all social workers for your contribution! #socialworker #worldsocialworkday #sgchildrensoc70

Are you a big fan of Carousell? Since June last year, Singapore Children’s Society has started to accept donations through the platform!

description:
Food insecurity refers to a state where one lacks physical and economic access to sufficient, nutritious food. Being cash-strapped and facing financial constraints, low-income families are more likely to experience food insecurity. 

To better understand their challenges and experiences, we interviewed children and caregivers from low-income families about their food consumption habits. 

Read more about their experiences in our last article, “How Do Low-Income Families Experience Food Insecurity?” and learn more about how you can do your part as an individual to support low-income families via the link in our bio.

#researchbites

What do you do when you suspect that child abuse is ongoing? Child abuse has been on the rise in Singapore for the past decade. Members of the community play a crucial role in responding to suspected child abuse to safeguard children. However, the decision to act and intervene is not always an easy one. 

In the second article of our February issue of Research Bites, “The Decision-making Experiences of Bystander Witnesses to Suspected Child Abuse”, we look at some of the tensions and dilemmas faced by bystanders to suspected child abuse, and how they decide whether or not to intervene. 

Read more via the link in our bio.

#researchbites
labels_str: advertisement poster flyer paper brochure

description:
Academic and education-related stressors can be difficult on children, but what about its effects on parents? How do parents experience the challenges that come with trying to support their children in their studies? 

We interviewed parents and professionals working with children to better understand parents’ experiences in relation to their children’s education. 

Read more about parents’ challenges and concerns in the first article, “Parenting as a Balancing Act: Challenges Relating to Involvement in Children’s Education” of our February issue of Research Bites via the link in our bio.

#researchbites
labels_str: poster advertisement flyer brochure paper

description:
新加坡儿童会总裁汪文敏在@capital958fm 采访中分享了儿童会成立70周年的里程碑。除了回顾我们的历史，文敏也叙述我们的服务如何不断进步与发展，以满足当今社会中儿童和青少年不断变化的需求。我们也通过节目呼吁儿童会早期的受益人与我们联系，分享他们珍贵的回忆。他们可以通过社交媒体与我们联系或发电邮info@childrensociety.org.sg。请点击我们bio链接观看视频。#sgchildrensoc70 
 
Singapore Children’s Society CEO Ang Boon Min shared about our Society’s 70th Anniversary milestone on Mediacorp Capital 958 radio station. Besides looking back on our history during the interview, she also shared about how our programmes and services evolved to meet the changing needs of children and youth. We also appealed for ex beneficiaries to contact us and share their precious memories. They can reach us directly via social media or email us at info@childrensociety.org.sg.  Click link in bio to watch the interview.

description:
“Don’t tell anyone, this is our secret,” is a phrase often used by perpetrators so that they can continue to commit sexual acts with children. Hence it is important to teach children the N.O.T. rules – to say No, walk Out, and Tell a trusted adult if they encounter a bad touch or inappropriate action.

Watch this short animation clip with your child and observe how April applies the N.O.T. rules in this unsafe situation.

#bodysafety #KidzLive

Can you spot your favourite CNY snack? 😋 While we’re soaking up the rest of the festive month with our remaining snacks at home, let’s do our part to give back to the ones who might not be able to enjoy them like we do.

description:
“Is it too early for preschool children to learn about sexuality?” – this is a question which the team behind our child sexual abuse prevention programme, KidzLive: I Can Protect Myself, commonly hears. It is never too early to start teaching body safety skills, and the key is to engage in age-appropriate conversations and to make use of teachable moments.

Here, we share our body safety infographic series and KidzLive information booklets that can be used as springboards for conversations. Share these resources with a parent, educator, or anyone who might be interested!

Visit the link in our bio for more info about the KidzLive booklets.

#bodysafety #KidzLive

description:
“There’s a lot of stigma and secrecy in talking about child sexual abuse,” said Ms Lin Xiaoling, Deputy Director of the Research and Advocacy Department at Singapore Children’s Society. Let's break the stigma and secrecy by overcoming our own barriers and start having a conversation with our children about body safety skills. 

Read more via the link in our bio.

Stay tuned for this week’s posts as we will be sharing resources that you can use as a springboard for further conversations.

#bodysafety #KidzLive

description:
The digital world is all around us, and it is here to stay. Our children and youth increasingly use and rely on digital technologies for a variety of reasons, which makes staying safe online more important. 

In this ParenTIPs podcast on Safer Internet Day, we hosted members of Project Techmap from the Singapore Children’s Forum 2021/22. Hear from our youth participants Daryl, Clarisse, and Ezann as they share about what they do online, what they like about it, as well as some of the issues they confront, including tensions with parents over screen time and usage. They also suggested tips for children and their parents/caregivers to ensure safe, engaging, and positive online experiences. 

Happy Safer Internet Day! 

Tune in to the podcast via the link in our bio.

#parentips #SaferInternetDay #SID2022 #sgchildrenforum
labels_str: person human advertisement poster flyer brochure paper text sport sports

labels_str: person human flyer paper brochure advertisement poster text

description:
The digital world is all around us, and it is here to stay. Our children and youth increasingly use and rely on digital technologies for a variety of reasons, which makes staying safe online more important. 

In this ParenTIPs podcast on Safer Internet Day, we hosted members of Project Techmap from the Singapore Children’s Forum 2021/22. Hear from our youth participants Daryl, Clarisse, and Ezann as they share about what they do online, what they like about it, as well as some of the issues they confront, including tensions with parents over screen time and usage. They also suggested tips for children and their parents/caregivers to ensure safe, engaging, and positive online experiences. 

Happy Safer Internet Day! 

Tune in to the podcast via the link in our bio.

#parentips #SaferInternetDay #SID2022 #sgchildrenforum

description:
Thank you @vasantham_mediacorp for visiting Student Service @ Children’s Society to have a chat with our Senior Social Worker, Ms Leela Narayana (right) who is part of the Tinkle Friend team. Leela shared about the common issues primary school students have raised when they call Tinkle Friend and the challenges they have faced amidst the pandemic. The episode in Tamil is now available for viewing (link in bio).

A self-funded service of Singapore Children’s Society, Tinkle Friend is a national toll-free helpline and chatline for all primary school students in Singapore. Tinkle Friend provides support, advice, and information to lonely and distressed children, especially in situations when their parents or main caregivers are unavailable. Trained staff and volunteers supporting the helpline and chatline operations guide children through problem-solving in a non-directive and caring approach.

description:
After 42 years of providing children a safe place to be while their parents worked, Student Care @ Children’s Society (SCC) in Bukit Merah View will close its doors on 31 December 2021.

The seeds for SCC were sown in the late 1970s when then-Prime Minister Lee Kuan Yew expressed concern about “latchkey children” – children who typically wore their house keys around their necks so they could let themselves into their homes after school. These children often returned to empty houses, and fended for themselves until their parents returned from work.

Through the decades, the Student Care service model has evolved with greater emphasis on supporting children from disadvantaged families with school-based student care. This is now available in almost all primary schools. The Ministry of Education is also expanding the After School Engagement programmes for both primary and secondary school students. Within Bukit Merah, many community agencies also provide similar services through their student care centres. This allows us to shift our focus to other needed programmes. We will work with community agencies to explore how we can continue to support the children and young persons living in the area in other ways.

On behalf of all past and present beneficiaries, thank you to the staff and volunteers who have kept the centre going for over four decades, and created fond memories to last a lifetime! ✨
labels_str: text banner

description:
Calling all children and youth under 18: What does mental health mean to you and why is it important? This is an invitation to you to record a short video message (30-60 secs) on mental health. Share your thoughts on the needs and challenges that young people face and what actions you think are needed to address them.
 
Organised by the @un_violenceagainstchildren and @crcasia, your message could be part of a video project with children all around Asia! The final video will be aired to healthcare professionals, civil society organisations and policy-makers around the world, among others.
 
Link in bio to access the complete child-friendly user guide and consent form. Deadline for entries is 10 January 2022. Let’s make children’s voices count!
 
#mentalhealth #childrensvoices #childrensrights

description:
We can’t think of a better combi: Commitment + Passion 🔥

If you’ve not caught our campaign video for Project Hope & Smiles - We had the privilege to chat with a few of our volunteers of Singapore Children’s Society & it left us feeling immensely inspired. 

One of our many takeaways is that one can shower love in different ways! Through donation, fundraising or volunteering with us – It’s with the same intent of bringing hope & smiles to our children, youth, and families in need.

Let’s continue to rise by lifting others. 
To donate & find out more, visit: bit.ly/hopeandsmiles_ or click the link in our bio 😊 

Spread the word, tell a friend, & support us by making a difference to their lives today!

description: How can young children fundraise to help other children who are in need? Low Jia Li, Manager and Team Lead from our Community Engagement and Partnerships Team shares in our Tips from the Expert series on how children can make a difference. #tipsfromtheexpert #fundraise
labels_str: person human text

description:
In the last episode, we spoke about school bullying and the impact it can have on children. Our speakers highlighted that children who experience bullying often do not speak up or seek help. Instead, they may try to downplay it or even perform their daily tasks as though it didn't happen. This is a challenge that parents and caregivers, even professionals, commonly face because we may not know when is the best time to step in and if there is even a need for us to do so.

Hear from our Bully-Free team as they share strategies and practical handles on how to support children. In this age of smart phones and rise of social media, they also explore and share some insights into cyberbullying. #bullyfree 

Podcast link in bio.
labels_str: advertisement poster flyer brochure paper

description: Singapore Children’s Society turns 70 in 2022! To celebrate this milestone, we want to hear from you. Tell us how your life as a current or former beneficiary, volunteer or even staff, has been impacted and touched by Children’s Society. Or contribute artwork for our special Anniversary collaterals. Your art piece can speak of your connection with us. You can DM us, email us at corpcomms@childrensociety.org.sg or find out more info at https://www.childrensociety.org.sg/articles/contribute-towards-our-70th-anniversary-celebrations

description: Wishing all our Hindu friends and supporters, a Happy Deepavali! May your festival of light celebrations be joyous and safe. ✨
labels_str: person human text flyer paper brochure poster advertisement

description:
Tomorrow, we celebrate the International day against violence and bullying at school, including cyberbullying. It is commemorated by UNESCO Member States every first Thursday of November each year. Regardless of the learning environment, be it at school or on the virtual realm, a child should feel safe as they grow. 

At Singapore Children’s Society, we run the Bully-Free programme that aims to build a safe and supportive school culture free from bullying. 

Tune in to the first of a 2-part series on bullying as professional speaking coach Benjamin Loh recounts his school bullying experiences and the negative impact it had on him. He is joined by Children’s Society’s Bully-Free team, as they share about the types of bullying and how to spot some of the warning signs. #bullyfree 

For more resources: please visit https://bullyfree.sg/
Tune in to https://anchor.fm/sgchildrensoc for current and future episodes of ParenTIPS.
labels_str: suit overcoat clothing coat apparel person human tie accessories accessory crowd blazer jacket man word skin

description: More than 70 volunteers & donors were honoured for their dedicated service and generous support at the Singapore Children’s Society Awards on Saturday 30 Oct. Held in a hybrid format, the Awards was held for recipients for the years 2020 and 2021, with more than 20 recipients receiving their awards from President Halimah Yacob at the onsite event. The Society's top service accolade, the Ruth Wong Award, was presented to Captain Suresh Menon and Dr Tan Seok Hui, for the year 2020 and 2021 respectively (Dr Tan attended the event virtually). Gartner Advisory (Singapore) Pte Ltd also received our Gopal Haridas Award for being our top donor. We thank all our award recipients for their unwavering support and dedication to Children’s Society and our beneficiaries.
labels_str: person human clothing apparel sleeve poster advertisement long sleeve

description:
How can we show better support to the little ones by making them feel heard?
We hope you have been following our campaign this month, where we highlighted the importance of reaching out, showing support & being empathetic towards their feelings.

May it serve as a reminder to everyone to always hear our children’s voices #intheirownwords 😊 

At Children’s Society, we strive to hear our children’s voices and use it to guide the work we do in bringing relief and happiness to children in need.
We offer an array of programmes & services to provide care and guidance to vulnerable children, youth & families in need.

Please support our work.
Donate generously at bit.ly/lkj-cd or click the link in our bio to make a positive impact on the lives of our beneficiaries.

description:
新加坡儿童会副主席何乃殷在近日的《联合早报》专访中谈及新生儿科专业及儿童受虐及被忽略课题，也对教育制度、家长和育儿之道表达看法。

In an interview with @zaobaosg, Deputy Chairman of Singapore Children’s Society Prof Ho Lai Yun shared more about the works of neonatology and advocated the importance of child abuse and neglect prevention. He also shared his views on the education system and parenting in Singapore.
 
🔗 Link in bio to read more.

description:
We hear children share the issues they face #intheirownwords and know that some may choose not to reach out to adults for support due to bad past experiences. Being more attuned to our children’s thoughts and feelings is the first step to build trust with them.
 
For this Children’s Day Special edition of #TipsFromTheExperts, let us hear from Grace and Mei Yi from Community Services & Programmes @ Children’s Society as they share more on how we can do so.
 
#hearourchildren #childrensday2021 #sgchildrensociety
labels_str: text plot

description:
#InTheirOwnWords: When some children encountered challenges, they were unable to seek help from adults or peers in their social network due to various reasons, such as having unhealthy parent-child interactions and negative experiences with help seeking.

How can we as adults build trust with children and be there for them when they need us? 

#hearourchildren #childrensday2021 #sgchildrensociety

description:
Do we really hear our children?
This Children’s Day, as we celebrate the little ones amongst us with fun & cheer, we wanted to also highlight the importance of making them feel heard.

At Children’s Society, we strive to hear our children’s voices #intheirownwords through our services and use it to guide the work that we do to bring relief and happiness to children in need.

We offer an array of programmes & services to reach out to children, like the Bully-Free Programme & Tinkle Friend just to name a few.

Every donation you make matters in supporting us while we continue to evolve to meet the changing needs of the children.

Visit bit.ly/lkj-cd or click the link in our bio to donate and find out more about our campaign.

Continue to spread a little kindness & lots of joy this Children’s Day!
#childrensday2021 #fundraising #charity #event #givingback #donatetoday

description:
在这华人传统节日，家家户户会共聚一堂，提灯赏月吃月饼，共庆秋收。然而并非每个孩童能够在一个快乐，完整或安全的家庭里度过中秋节。

在我们的社会里有需要保护或是无法获得父母妥善照顾甚至遭受虐待的弱势孩童。儿童虐待可以分很多种，有的是对他们的肉体造成伤害以致出现瘀伤和骨折，有的则是情感虐待或忽视。这都有可能在他们的心灵留下深刻又持久的伤痕。

儿童在年幼时遭受这种严酷待遇，不仅会打击他们的自信心以及培养健康人际关系的能力，也会导致他们无法如常生活。

新加坡儿童会深信每个孩子都应拥有一个安全和稳定的成长环境，不受虐待和忽视等问题困扰。您的支持能够为孩子们的生活带来正面的影响。

在这中秋佳节，请献爱心，送温暖，将爱与希望传递给需要帮助的人。您的每一笔捐款将用于资助新加坡儿童会，并且展开旗下的服务项目与计划，为有需要帮助的儿童、青少年及家庭伸出援手， 改变他们的生活。
 
欲知详情或捐款，请浏览 bit.ly/hopeinthedark2021 或点击简介中链 ✨

description:
新加坡儿童会和国家法院合作，于1988年推行弱势证人援助计划（Vulnerable Witness Support Programme），目的是为必须出庭供证的弱势群体提供援助。家事法院于2016年加入该计划。新加坡儿童会两名资深志愿者萨拉沙（Sarasa Seshadri）和郑琇璟在《联合早报》的采访中分享了他们当义工的心路历程和他们如何在漫长的法庭程序中陪同儿童证人。 

In an interview with @zaobaosg, Singapore Children’s Society’s volunteers Mdm Sarasa Seshadri and Ms Celine Tay shared about the Vulnerable Witness Support Programme (VWSP), a programme coordinated by Children’s Society with the State Courts and Family Justice Courts to provide emotional, non-evidentiary practical support to vulnerable child witnesses under the age of 18 who have to testify in criminal cases. They also shared key takeaways from their years of volunteering and strategies they use to lift the spirits of the child witnesses amidst the long court processes. 

🔗 Link in bio to read more. Photo Illustration by 梁锦泉

description:
Did you know that 90% of your child’s brain is developed by the time they are 5 years old❓

KidSTART is a programme that aims to give children a good start in life by providing upstream support to children aged 6 and below. Under @kidstartsingapore, we provide support for child development, coordinate and strengthen holistic services for families where needed, and monitor the developmental progress of children from birth onwards. In addition, we also support eligible families in their child’s preschool enrolments to better prepare them for subsequent years of formal education.

Here at KidSTART @ Singapore Children’s Society, we support KidSTART families in Bedok and Geylang Serai with Singaporean children below the age of 6 and earning a household income of below $2,500. If you are pregnant or have a child aged 6 and below, come join us for our first KidSTART Digital Roadshow on Saturday, 18 September, 10.30am to 11.30am to find out how you can make a difference in your child’s early developmental years! Stand to win attractive prizes by participating in the fun, interactive activities prepared for you and your children! 

Register now for the free Zoom roadshow via link in bio. Registration closes on 15 September, don’t miss out! 😊

description:
9.9 – The day everyone gets excited over shopping! While you bag deals from your Lazada app, be sure to check out our listings. 

Have you heard? Our #walkforourchildren2021 has just launched, and you are now able to purchase the event tickets off @lazada_sg directly. How convenient is that?

Here’s how to make your Lazada shopping experience a unique one this 9.9.
 
1. Search ‘Singapore Children’s Society’ on Lazada, or visit bit.ly/lazadaforagoodcause
2. Select your choice of tickets and add to cart
3. Put on your trusty track shoes and start clocking at least 8,000 steps
4. And….feel good because you're doing good! ⭐ 
 
It’s as simple as it reads 😊 To find out more about our event, visit: www.walkforourchildren.sg.

#LazadaSG #Lazada99 #woc2021 #charitywalk #walkforacause #fundraising #walkathon

description:
[Calling youth aged 13 to 18] Is it okay to take a path less travelled? ⛰ With the kind of academic expectations society places on us, we're bound to feel the heat. But everyone's journey is different, and that's okay.

So how do we still make sense and meaning of our own path, regardless of what it is? And how do we stick to following our own path?

Hear from our guest speaker Ms Faith Ng, Associate Artistic Director of @checkpointtheatre as she shares her journey of how she started out as a young writer, including the mistakes and discoveries she made along the way, and learn why it's important to hold true to who we are.

Sign up today via the link in bio! This learning session is organised as part of the Singapore Children's Forum 2021/2022.

#sgchildrensociety #sgchildrenforum #studyinginsingapore #pathlesstravelled

description:
EXCITING NEWS AHEAD - Exclusively for those who have signed up for Walk for Our Children 2021 (Virtual Edition) Event!
 
We’re bringing the carnival cheer to you 🎉
You heard us right!  We’ll be hosting a Virtual Origami Workshop on 10 Sept & 25 Sept!

This ancient Japanese art form helps develop our hand-eye coordination, fine motor skills & mental concentration.
Mark your calendars & join us on 10 Sept at 10am for our first session!
 
Participants will learn how to fold 4 – 5 beautiful art pieces from basic to intermediate level during the 1 hour session.
 
You’ll receive workshop sign-in details from your Virtual Walk Account under the notification button 🔔 or look out for our email!
 
PLUS – Successfully refer 2 friends to register & receive a $10 Fairprice Voucher!
How:
- Get your referral code from your Virtual Walk Account under the profile button after you’ve logged in
- Ask your friends to sign up using your referral code
 
Not registered for our virtual event yet? Hurry before it’s too late! Visit www.walkforourchildren.sg or click on the link in our bio to sign up now.
 
#walkforourchildren2021 #fundraising #charity #event #givingback #donatetoday

description: What things bring you comfort? If it is food, what is your comfort food? We asked you this question on IG story and some of your responses include waffles & ice cream, porridge and fish head curry! We also asked our Sunbeam Place residents the same question. Besides hanging out with friends, listening to music & getting encouragement or hand written notes from our staff, one favourite comfort food amongst them was bubble tea! Thanks to an anonymous donor who delivered bubble tea to all our Sunbeam Place residents over the weekend and made their day! #comfortfood #bubbleteasg

description:
[Calling youth aged 13 to 18] As digital natives in today’s world, the use of digital media is deeply embedded in our lives.

The online world allows us to access useful information, create content, communicate with our friends and family and much more. On the other hand, it is also where we can be exposed to harm.

How can you stay safe and informed as you engage with the digital world? 🌏 

Hear from our guest speakers Mr David Ng, a child rights advocate on online safety and digital citizenship and @flagyoureit, Singapore's first movement against online child grooming.

Sign up today via the link in bio! This learning session is organised as part of the Singapore Children’s Forum 2021/2022.

#sgchildrensociety #sgchildrenforum #digitalworld #stayingsafeonline
labels_str: flyer brochure poster advertisement paper

description: Our ‘Tips from the Expert’ Series examines the role of families as the backbone of our nation. Nisa Nurdini Binte Johar, Social Worker at our Yishun Family Service @ Children's Society shares tips for parents to practice self-care. #tipsfromtheexpert

description:
Do you know what social and emotional learning is about? Our last article, "Developing social emotional competencies with the PATHS programme", addresses that and also shares how Children's Society promotes social and emotional competence through an evidence-based Social and Emotional Learning programme – Promoting Alternative Thinking Strategies (PATHS). 

Read more via the link in our bio!

description:
Whether you work with children, are a parent or a neighbour, we would like to invite you to join our Lecture on 28 August 2021. Join us as Mrs Priscilla Lui shares how we can embark on “A Shared Journey Safeguarding our Children” with community power, engagement, and participation.

Register now via the link in our bio. The registration deadline has been extended to 26 August. Registration is free.

#protectchildren #children

description:
You might have guessed it! Our signature fundraising event Walk for Our Children (Virtual edition) is back 😎 Registration starts TODAY!
 
Join in the fun with your family & friends by clocking in your steps🚶Here’s how:
1) Register now
2) Walk around anywhere in Singapore when the event starts on 1 Sept
3) Log into the event website to upload your step count + play our games to stand a chance to win prizes
 
Click the link in our bio to register & find out more!
 
PLUS - All registrants will each receive a free fun pack (while stocks last) with a certificate of participation!
Psst.. Register early to ALSO receive a Kids DIY Slipper Kit 🌈
 
Funds raised from this event will go towards Singapore Children’s Society and the programmes & services we run for the beneficiaries under our care.

#walkforourchildren2021 #thereveal #staytuned #fundraising #charity #event #givingback #donatetoday

description:
Calling all parents, educators, and social service professionals!
Do you want to know more about trauma, its prevalence in Singapore, and how to integrate trauma-informed care into your lives?

Safe Circle is a collaboration across seven agencies that focuses on community-based mental health services for children and youth. Singapore Children's Society is a part of this collaboration, and we are offering a complimentary workshop and talk on trauma-informed care.

For more details, visit the link in our bio.

#traumainformed #traumainformedcare #mentalhealth #safecircle #talksandworkshops #sgchildrensociety

description:
For our 14th Lecture, we invited Mrs Priscilla Lui to speak about how we can safeguard our children. Apart from being a child rights advocate, she was also heavily involved on the ground in child protection work. Watch this video to hear her memorable experience working with children and families!

Whether you work with children directly or simply care about them, we hope to see you at the Lecture, because in the words of our speaker, it takes "community power, community engagement and participation" to nurture and protect our children.

Register via the link in our bio. Registration is free. See you there!

description:
Residents of Sunbeam Place @ Children’s Society had a splendid time celebrating our nation’s birthday! ✨ 

Soaking in the festivities, residents were dressed up in red and white and familiar National Day songs were played throughout the day. Besides watching the NDP Ceremonial Parade, our residents also learned to cook local delicacies such as chicken rice, nasi briyani and nasi lemak with the help of staff members.

We hope you too had a wonderful weekend! 😊

#NDP2021 #TogetherOurSGSpirit #ndpeeps

description:
Our heartiest congratulations to our Deputy Chairman Prof Ho Lai Yun for being conferred the Public Service Star (Bar) for this year's National Day Awards! Prof Ho started volunteering with Singapore Children's Society in 1988; today he is the Society’s Deputy Chairman as well as the Chairman of our Research and Advocacy Standing Committee (RASC). 

Under Prof Ho's leadership, RASC is actively engaged in different aspects of work done on the prevention of child abuse and neglect in Singapore. The Singapore Children’s Society Lecture, inaugurated in 2007 to mark the Society’s 55th Anniversary Celebrations, was also Prof Ho’s brainchild. The annual lecture which features an expert speaker on a subject related to children, youth and families, reaches out to professionals working with children and families as well as to the members of the public.

Besides having dedicated more than 30 years to champion for the protection and well-being of children in Singapore, Prof Ho has also been an active volunteer in other aspects of work in Children’s Society. Sitting on multiple committees, he serves in the Human Resource and Remuneration Committee and the Nominations Committee. He is also the Deputy Chairman of the Crisis Management Committee and the Chairman of the Awards Committee for the Singapore Children’s Society Awards, which formally recognises volunteers and donors for their dedication and generosity. 

On behalf of all staff and beneficiaries, thank you Prof Ho, for your dedication and contribution!

(Photo taken during the 13th Singapore Children’s Society Lecture in 2019 where Prof Ho moderated the Q&A session)
labels_str: poster advertisement person human standing paper flyer brochure

description:
Since 1999, Singapore Children’s Society has conducted two sets of studies on the public's and professionals' perceptions of child abuse and neglect, and how perceptions have changed over time. 

In the second article of our latest issue of Research Bites, "Understanding perceptions of child abuse and neglect in Singapore: Our progress and future directions", we review major child protection milestones in Singapore and discuss the lessons we learnt from the perception studies. 

Read more via the link in our bio!

description:
[Calling youth aged 13 to 18] COVID-19 has impacted us in unprecedented ways. It has lasted more than a year and we can feel the COVID fatigue setting in. How can we then bounce back better? 💪
 
In this session, local researcher Mr Kwan Jin Yao will discuss findings from his ongoing study on the long-term effects of COVID-19 on youth in Singapore. Kids’ Dream, a child-led group from Hong Kong, will also share their experiences and talk about a survey they conducted with children during the pandemic. Join us in this important discussion and share your views as we learn to embrace the new normal. 
 
Sign up via the link in bio today! This learning session is organised as part of the Singapore Children’s Forum 2021/2022.
 
#sgchildrensociety #sgchildrenforum #covidtimes
labels_str: graphics art text

description:
When Singapore went through Circuit Breaker between April and June 2020 due to COVID-19, major changes such as school closures and parents working from home could have impacted children’s access to social support. To understand children's experiences during this period, we analysed some Tinkle Friend online chats which is our national chat platform for primary school children. 

Read more about children’s concerns in the first article, "A friend in need: Children’s concerns during the COVID-19 pandemic" of our July issue of Research Bites via the link in our bio!

description:
“What are you thankful for?” 💖
This National Day, we hope to make it more meaningful with our campaign themed: #IAmThankfulFor to remind each other to notice the silver lining in every dark cloud ⛅️ 
 
For Singapore Children’s Society, even though the past one and a half years have been extremely challenging, we are thankful for all the support you have given us in different ways and it motivates us to continue doing what we do best – bringing relief and happiness to children, youth, & families in need.
 
May this video put a smile on your faces & warm your hearts like it did to ours! We encourage you to send a note or video to your loved ones & post it on your socials 😊 Be sure to tag us & use the hashtags #IAmThankFulFor & #sgchildrensocND, we can’t wait to see them!
 
We hope you can continue to support us. Every donation you make will continue helping us and our beneficiaries in immeasurable ways.
 
Click the link on our bio to donate and find out more ✨
Let’s continue to stand strong in unity & uplift each other.

#IAmThankfulFor #sgchildrensocND #happynationalday #fundraising #charity #givingback #donatetoday

description:
At a recent UN global meeting of world leaders, youth from all over the world spoke about making the mental health of children a priority as we build back better from COVID-19.

💬 Our very own youth member, Joanne from JYC @ Children’s Society, is featured at 2:18 of this impactful video message - link in bio! Joanne is also part of the group which composed the song, ‘Signs’ to raise awareness on the need of seeking help when one experiences early signs of distress.

description:
Our annual Singapore Children's Society Lecture is back and will be taking place on 28 August!

For our 14th Lecture, we are thrilled to have Mrs Priscilla Lui as our speaker. She will share with us from her wealth of experience as a child rights advocate and child protection professional in Hong Kong. Watch this short video to get to know her a little better and hear what she has to say! 

Register your interest to attend via the link in our bio. Registration is free.
labels_str: advertisement poster flyer brochure paper text

description:
[An event for youths aged 13 to 18] Adolescence can be a difficult period to navigate and it is not uncommon for children and youth to experience mental health challenges today. 

Hear from our speakers, Adj A/Prof Daniel Fung, CEO of Institute of Mental Health and Ms Julia Kwek, Case Worker of Youth Service @ Children’s Society as they share more on the mental health trends and issues affecting children and youth in Singapore today. Pick up useful skills and strategies on how to cope with difficult emotions, how to seek help and how to support your peers.

Organised as part of the Singapore Children’s Forum 2021/2022, the first half of the session (2.00pm - 3.00pm) is open to all interested children and youths aged 13 to 18. We welcome you to join us in this important conversation. To register, please click the link in bio.
 
#sgchildrensforum #sgchildrensociety #mentalhealth #mentalwellbeing

description:
Do you know what benevolent childhood experiences are? Researchers are now looking into the positive factors that might buffer children from the negative impact of traumatic or stressful experiences.

Hear more from our guest speakers, Adj A/Prof Daniel Fung, CEO of the Institute of Mental Health and Toh Sze Min, Research Officer from Singapore Children’s Society, about the kinds of connections and communities that would benefit children.

The last episode of this two-part ParenTIPS series also touches on what caregivers can do if they had experienced ACES when they were younger.

Tune in via the link in our bio.

#parenting #parentingsg #parentips

description:
Our guest speakers, Adj A/Prof Daniel Fung, CEO of the Institute of Mental Health and Toh Sze Min, Research Officer from Singapore Children’s Society, share local research findings about ACES and discuss its impact on children. They describe the potential signs that can alert caregivers and educators that a child is negatively affected by ACES and suggest ways on how adults can respond.

Tune in to the podcast via the link in our bio.

description:
Fathers play an important role in children’s development and shaping their behaviours. 

In celebration ​​​of Father’s Day this weekend, we look at how the emotional bond between fathers and their children influence the development of children's social skills. We hope that these tips would help fathers connect better with their children. 

Refer to the link in our bio to view the full article in our Research Bites.

We hear you! Here are some tips on managing children’s anger.

These tips are based on our ongoing anger management program for children – Storm Riders, and we hope you will give them a try!

#angermanagement #stormriders

description:
With the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, we looked into the influence of COVID-19 on children’s social support during Circuit Breaker last year.

Based on the data gathered from our Tinkle Friend online chats, we found that some children experienced relationship difficulties with their parents due to blurred work-life boundaries. Some children also had difficulties reaching out to teachers and friends for support.  With recent tighter safe distancing measures and work-from-home as default once again, we draw upon some of the lessons learnt to provide tips on how families can cope better this time.

#COVID-19 #CopingwithCOVID
labels_str: text poster advertisement flyer brochure paper document page

description:
Did you know that when you feel unsafe, your body gives you warning signs?

Safe Simon teaches children to recognise when they feel unsafe, and to tell a trusted adult what is happening. Share this video or show it to a child and teach him/her to follow what Safe Simon says. 

#protectchildren #safesimon

description:
Keep our children safe. Whether you’re a neighbour, friend or relative – Help to protect the children in our community.

With more stress and tension on families in 2020, the number of child abuse cases investigated hit the highest in a decade. We need a strong network to support vulnerable children before abuse occurs. Everyone needs to play their part to keep our children safe.

Refer to the link in our bio for more Covid-19 resources that we had produced during the Circuit breaker last year.

description:
#casestory
At a young age, Alisah* was separated from her parents due to their incarceration and has been living in Sunbeam Place @ Children's Society since then. Due to the separation, it created some resistance and anxiety in meeting her birth parents when they
were first released from prison. Over time, Alisah built up her trust with them, only to be disappointed when her parents got caught for taking drugs again. 

The adversities caused Alisah difficulties in keeping up with her studies and she developed maladaptive ways to cope with her struggles such as hitting her head against the wall. Despite the unfavourable family circumstances and various health concerns, Alisah showed great tenacity and resilience. With the help of care workers at Sunbeam Place @ Children’s Society, she managed to cope better and developed good moral values. 

Help us to continue providing beneficiaries like Alisah, a safe and nurturing space to develop and grow. A donation of $50 can help cover the transportation costs for a child. Start impacting lives today (link in bio). 

*Name has been changed to protect the identity of our beneficiary

description:
How is your child feeling in this third week of Phase 2 (Heightened Alert)? Children could be feeling worried and unsettled by the changes, or may be feeling lonely or bored. As a caregiver, you, can look out for these emotions in your child. Here, we share some tips on what you can do to support your child during this period.

Refer to the link in our bio for more Covid-19 resources that we had produced during the Circuit breaker last year.

description:
#casestory⁣
From birth, children would have received much care and attention from their parents. However not all children have the opportunity to⁣
grow up in a nurturing environment. John* was only 3 when he witnessed the arrest of his parents due to drug offences.⁣
⁣
As a little boy, he would look forward to the release of his parents hoping to have a complete family. However, his dreams were ⁣
short-lived as his parents continued with their addictions, leading to multiple incarcerations. Because of this, John suffered multiple placement breakdowns, moving from living with his family to his relatives, to a shelter for displaced families and finally to Sunbeam Place @ Children's Society.⁣
⁣
Despite these difficult times, John persevered and remained resilient. His interest and talent in floorball kept him grounded as he focused his energy in it and as a result, was able to apply for the school of his choice via Direct School Admission.⁣
⁣
With just $90, you can help us to look after one beneficiary, like John for one month by sponsoring his meal costs. This amount might seem small, but it will make a big difference in their lives. Start impacting lives today (link in bio).
⁣
*Name has been changed to protect the identity of our beneficiary

description:
Research Bites is celebrating our 5th anniversary! To celebrate this milestone, our 10th issue features the theme of children's voices.
 
Our first article, "Which types of social support promote resilience among children from low-income families?" highlights the impact of income-related stressors on child outcomes, and the importance of children’s perspectives on their social support. Our study advisor, Dr. Quah Saw Han, also shared insights about these findings and how they can help us to better serve children in need. 
 
In our second article, "Respecting children’s voices: How can practitioners promote child participation?", we explore child participation and provide tips on how we encourage children’s voices using examples from our services.
 
Our last article, "What can you do if your child experiences academic stress?", shares the common sources of academic stress experienced by children and ways parents can engage children in conversations relating to academic stress.
 
Read our latest issue via the link in our bio!
labels_str: poster advertisement flyer brochure paper hand

description:
🎵 You’re now listening to: Signs 🎶

After a year in making, we present Signs, a song written and produced by our very own youth members from JYC @ Children’s Society (GIG @ JYC) to raise awareness on the need of seeking help when one experiences early signs of distress.

Through this music video, we hope to help listeners identify signs of distress and remind them that support can be found around them. 

A quick shout-out to Leonard from the @snakeweedstudios  for making this possible through your help with the song’s recording!

#SignsbySCS #mentalhealth #mentalhealthawareness #sgchildrensociety
labels_str: flyer brochure poster advertisement paper

description:
Calling all parents! Did you know that Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs), which are potentially traumatic events that happen before the age of 18, can have a long-lasting impact on children's physical and mental well-being? 
 
Safe Circle is a collaboration across seven agencies including the Singapore Children’s Society, that focuses on community-based mental health services for children and youth. In this second run, we are offering a complimentary workshop on trauma-informed care for parents. 
 
Sign up to learn about what trauma entails, its prevalence in Singapore and how to integrate trauma-informed care into your lives as parents. For more details and to register, please click here: bit.ly/safecircle2021

#traumainformed #traumainformedcare #mentalhealth #safecircle #talksandworkshops #sgchildrensociety

description:
Anger is an emotion that everyone experiences. However, coping with anger can be challenging for some children, leading to behavioural outbursts or disruptive behaviours. Moreover, the many changes caused by the ongoing pandemic may pose greater challenges for children to cope with their emotions. It is important that children learn and find ways to manage these strong and intense feelings.

Join our Storm Riders programme over the June school holidays to find out how children can manage their emotions in a safe and healthy manner. Sign up now at bit.ly/StormRiders2021 (link in bio). Do also share this post with others whom you think may benefit from it!

#anger #angermanagement #angerissues #emotionalhealth #emotion #regulation
labels_str: qr code person human

description:
#casestory
At the young age of 2, Shan* was admitted to Sunbeam Place @ Children's Society as her parents were unable to care for her due to drug addiction and depression issues. Her mother passed on when she was only 7 years old and Shan stayed on at Sunbeam Place @ Children’s Society. 

Shan remained positive and disciplined in her school work, working hard as she aims to be an accountant in the future. She scored good grades in her preliminary examinations and strives to enrol in an accounting course in a local polytechnic. 

At Sunbeam Place @ Children's Society, we provide a temporary home for children and youth who have been abused or severely neglected to live in. They too, have the right to having their basic needs met just like their age peers. This includes going to school as usual and having pocket money to buy their meals.

With just $45, you’ll help us to look after one beneficiary, like Shan for one month by paying towards her school pocket money. This amount might seem small, but it will make a big difference in their lives. Click the link in our bio to start impacting lives today.

*Name has been changed to protect the identity of our beneficiary

#shopforacause #lazada #giveback #nonprofit
labels_str: text flyer poster brochure paper advertisement

description:
What needs to be in place for positive parenting to happen? Parents need to be attuned to their children's needs, and this means building up a trusting and secure relationship from young. Helping children understand the consequences of their actions on others is also an effective parenting strategy to learn. Hear about these and more in part two of this three-part series on positive parenting. 

Tune in at https://anchor.fm/sgchildrensoc

#parenting #parentingsg #parentips
labels_str: poster advertisement flyer brochure paper

description:
Safe Circle is a collaboration across seven agencies including the Singapore Children’s Society, that focuses on community-based mental health services for children and youth. In this second run, we are offering a complimentary workshop on trauma-informed care for parents. 

Sign up to learn about what trauma entails, its prevalence in Singapore and how to integrate trauma-informed care into your lives as parents. For more details and to register, please click here: bit.ly/safecircle2021 

#traumainformed #traumainformedcare #mentalhealth #safecircle #talksandworkshops #sgchildrensociety

description:
We start off the first of our ParenTIPS podcast exploring the issue of positive parenting. In the first of this three-part series, we look at corporal punishment as a disciplinary approach, and understand what science tells us about the effectiveness and impact of it. Joining us are clinical psychologist, Dr Quah Saw Han and developmental psychologist, Dr Cheung Hoi Shan.

Tune in at https://anchor.fm/sgchildrensoc

#parenting #parentingsg #parentips

description:
Are you looking for a fun and educational activity to do with your child during this March school holidays? 

Embark on an adventure with Eli the elephant and his friends ‘onboard’ our Choo Choo Train. This resource is a series of 16 stories and activities aimed to inculcate values like compassion and honesty in five- and six-year-old children. 

For more stories, please check out the link in our bio.

Hurry, Eli and his friends are waiting to meet you onboard the Choo Choo Train! 

#choochootrainresource #choochootrain #moralvalues #courtesy #gratitude #kindness #compassion

description:
元宵节快乐! Did you know the first full moon of the Lunar calendar today symbolizes the reunion of families? 😊 

Today also marks our first physical fundraising event (and a very socially distanced one!) – Tee Up for Our Children 🏑 – after one full year of cancelled events. All funds raised through this event will go towards running programmes at one of our service centres, JYC @ Children's Society - a community drop-in centre which focuses on engaging children and youth meaningfully to develop their strengths, build their self-confidence and pre-empt a path of juvenile delinquency. 

As one of our JYC members put it, ‘It is really more than just a centre. I can even call it my home after all my experiences here and the sense of belonging I have built in here.’ 

Help us keep our JYC family running for our current and future beneficiaries. Click the link in our bio to donate today! 

#fundraising #donatetoday #youthoftomorrow

description:
This is what kindness means to one of our young beneficiaries from our programme Project LADDER, which aims to sustain and strengthen positive relationships and connections for families who are affected by incarceration.

“Do things for people not because of who they are or what they do in return, but because of who you are”.

As the Lunar New Year celebrations draw to a close this week, we would like to appeal to you to embrace the spirit of kindness and donate generously towards our campaign – A Little Kindness, Lots of Joy! Your donations will support the Children’s Society’s programmes like Project LADDER, bringing smiles to our beneficiaries and making an impact in their lives. Spread your kindness here: www.giving.sg/singapore-children-s-society/lkn

description:
Did you know today is Safer Internet Day?
 
With easy access to the internet and electronic devices, children get to play, learn, create, and connect. It is important for them to stay safe while navigating the digital world.
 
Start having conversations with your children about how they can stay safe online. Our friends @crcasia have also made a book for children to be e-safe!

www.tinyurl.com/SafeWebForKids

#SID2021 #SaferInternetDay #cyberwellness #sgparenting #ParenTIPS

description:
Safe Circle is a collaboration across seven agencies including the Singapore Children’s Society, that focuses on community-based mental health services for children and youth. 

We are offering a complimentary talk and workshop on trauma-informed care for parents and educators. Learn about what trauma entails, its prevalence in Singapore and even how to integrate trauma-informed care into your work and lives.

For more details and to sign up, please click here: bit.ly/safecircle2021

#traumainformed #traumainformedcare #mentalhealth #safecircle #talksandworkshops #sgchildrensociety
labels_str: toy wood sphere plastic

description:
A big thank you to the @playeum team and Coach Mike from Tendencies for organising an interesting and fun activity for the residents of Sunbeam Place @ Children’s Society! This project is also supported by @temasektrustsg's oscar@sg fund.

Towards the end of last year, our residents gathered for an exciting Art of Speed challenge where they worked together to build a moving vehicle with recyclable materials such as toilet rolls and unused plastic cutlery as well as motors and batteries. Their vehicles were then put to a test to see if they could survive moving through a track that was filled with obstacles.

Through experiment and play, our residents had a lot of fun learning about physics as well as discovering new things about themselves and their friends such as their strengths and weaknesses!

#physics #handsonlearning #experiment #play #oscarsgfund #sunbeamplace #sgchildrensociety
labels_str: icing food dessert cake cream creme sphere

description:
A big thank you to the @playeum team and Coach Mike from Tendencies for organising an interesting and fun activity for the residents of Sunbeam Place @ Children’s Society! This project is also supported by @temasektrustsg's oscar@sg fund.

Towards the end of last year, our residents gathered for an exciting Art of Speed challenge where they worked together to build a moving vehicle with recyclable materials such as toilet rolls and unused plastic cutlery as well as motors and batteries. Their vehicles were then put to a test to see if they could survive moving through a track that was filled with obstacles.

Through experiment and play, our residents had a lot of fun learning about physics as well as discovering new things about themselves and their friends such as their strengths and weaknesses!

#physics #handsonlearning #experiment #play #oscarsgfund #sunbeamplace #sgchildrensociety

description:
Have you joined the characters, Sam, Dan and Lydia in saving the fictional world of Scribble Town? ⚓️

To raise awareness on the issue of bullying, Singapore Children’s Society has collaborated with the National Heritage Board to present Scribble Town, an interactive exhibition for children aged between 9 and 12. The exhibition held at the Sun Yat Sen Nanyang Memorial Hall ends this 31 January so make your way down if you have yet to! 

Through the interactive elements at each station, visitors will be prompted to reflect on their own experiences of bullying, whether they have been victims of bullying themselves or have acted in ways that count as bullying. 
 
For more information on bullying, visit www.bullyfree.sg. Together we can create a #bullyfreesg.

#antibullying #SayNotoBullying #exhibition #museum #ilovemuseums #sgchildrensociety

description:
It’s about THREE weeks to the Lunar New Year. For many of us, this festive period speaks of family reunion. As we look forward to gathering with our families and relatives albeit in smaller groups, there are some families like Madam Tan’s* who are not able to get together to celebrate this Lunar New Year due to an incarcerated family member. 

Click on the link in our bio to read more about Madam Tan’s story and support us in our efforts to strengthen families. 

Donate today and embrace the spirit of kindness and giving this Lunar New Year. 

*Name has been changed to protect the identity of our beneficiary 

#alittlekindnesslotsofjoy #fundraising #giving

description:
Happy Boxing Day! We hope you are having a great Christmas weekend with your loved ones. 

2020 has not been an easy year for all of us, but you have made it possible for us to support our beneficiaries amidst the pandemic. From the bottom of our hearts ❤️, we thank you! 

We are also at the tail end of our #BeOurSanta 🎅 campaign. Grab the chance to make your final contribution in the link in our bio! 

As 2021 approaches, we hope you can continue to support the work we do at Singapore Children’s Society. Have a smashing last few days of 2020! 

#TheGivingStories #GivingWeekSG

description:
In partnership with Singapore Children’s Society, @british_theatre_playhouse is hosting a campaign called “Give a Child a Book” where members of the public can purchase a Christmas book produced by the British Theatre Playhouse entitled, ‘Covi, the little Christmas dinosaur’ for the children cared for by Children’s Society. This book features a real-life 7-year-old girl, Harmonie-Rose who lost her arms and legs to meningitis when she was just 1 year old. It is their hope (and ours) that reading this book will raise awareness of meningitis and inspire children around the world during these difficult times. On top of that, you may also donate to Singapore Children’s Society to support the programmes and services that we run for children, youth and families in need. ⁣
⁣
Join us this Christmas in bringing hope to the children at Singapore Children’s Society through Covi, the little Christmas Dinosaur! Visit this link to purchase the book or donate to us > bit.ly/giveachildabook

description:
Before @thefort.scs open its doors back in October 2018, youth workers carried out a Community Needs Assessment which included surveying youth in the area to understand more about the facilities and programmes they would like to see in a youth drop-in centre.

The Fort @ Children’s Society has since been a safe space for youth members to hang out after school hours and engage in activities they enjoy such as cooking, baking, and gaming. Through the various programmes and activities designed to suit the needs of the youth, the Centre also aims to develop the youth’s strengths in the 5Cs – Caring, Character, Competence, Confidence and Connection.

➡️ For more on our reflections behind the setting up of a youth drop-in space and effective engagement with youths, download a copy of ‘A Guide to Youth Drop-In Centres’ from the link in bio!

#youthcentre #youthwork #youth #dropincentre #resource

description:
Walk for Our Children 2020 (Virtual Edition) has officially ended and what better way to close an event than to give away prizes! Here are our top 3 winners for each of our e-games for the #walkforourchildren2020 event 😎! Our staff will be in touch with you shortly on claiming your prizes* ⁣
⁣
Last but not least, a huge THANK YOU to everyone for your participation for #walkforourchildren2020! It's our first time holding a virtual walk and we could not have done it without you! Thank you for helping us go above and beyond our 20 million steps target and most importantly, raise funds to support programmes and services for our beneficiaries. We hope you’ve had a great time with your family and friends. ⁣
⁣
See you next year 👋! ⁣
⁣
*Vouchers are kindly sponsored by the National Environment Agency.

description:
It’s DECEMBER! *cue Christmas jingles* We have finally entered the season of giving 😀

For this festive period, we had a rare gathering for our staff members across the different service centres to share about the ups and downs in Singapore Children’s Society this year. If you like to find out what we have done this year and how we have helped our beneficiaries tide through COVID-19, click on the link in our bio to watch! #BeOurSanta #TheGivingStories #GivingWeekSG

description:
Singapore Children’s Society has launched ‘A Guide to Youth Drop-In Centres: Reflections from Research and Practice’ to consolidate the research, theories and reflections behind the setting up of a youth drop-in space and effective engagement with youths. This guide is an enhanced version of an early guide released in 2011, which articulates the practice wisdom and research findings behind the operations of a youth drop-in centre. 

➡️ Find out more about the guide and download a complimentary copy from the link in bio!

#youthcentre #youthwork #youth #dropincentre #resource

description:
#Fact: The number of applications for financial assistance has doubled and the funds disbursed under Singapore Children’s Society’s Casework Fund almost tripled this year compared to last year. 

Our Casework Fund provides financial assistance to needy families so that they can pay for meals, daily necessities, children’s school expenses etc. Help our beneficiaries by donating to our Virtual Flag Day campaign. All donations raised will go towards the Society’s Casework Fund and any unused Casework Fund donations will be carried over to 2021 and beyond so that we can continue to extend a lifeline to as many families in need. 

Give from your ❤️ today, click on the link in our bio!

description:
Singapore Children’s Society Flag Day has gone virtual this year! 🚩 

All donations raised from the Virtual Flag Day campaign will go towards our Casework Fund which provides financial assistance to needy families. 

As a result of the pandemic, Mr Johnson* lost his job in February 2020 as a security guard and has been struggling to support his family of seven in meeting their basic needs 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦. 

Visit bit.ly/virtualflagday20 to read more about his story and find out how you can help him and other families who are in similar predicaments when you make a donation towards our Casework Fund. #COVID19 #SGUnited #SGTogether 

*Name has been changed to protect our beneficiary’s identity
labels_str: plot diagram

description:

⁣

description:
#Didyouknow that 1 out of 4 students have been bullied in real life, and 1 in 9 students were bullied online? Students who were bullied have poorer mental health compared to those weren’t. 

In support of our Bully-Free Programme, we are delighted to have @deloittesingapore onboard to fundraise for our Society! With its support, Deloitte’s WorldClass campaign will help advance the programme’s endeavour to make an impact that matters. 

To find out more about the campaign, visit http://bit.ly/deloittebullyfree 

#DeloitteWorldClass #dogood #nonprofit #charity #socialgood

description:
In the month of October, we celebrate CHILDREN 👫 – the future of our nation. Singapore Children’s Society has been working hard for 68 years to promote the well-being of children. 
 
Did you know that there are children of pre-school age who do not receive the education they need to build a strong foundation in their learning journeys? In this video, our counsellor Joanne tells us why pre-school education is important, and how we reach out to families in need so that their children do not miss out on pre-school education as a result of their circumstances. 

Please donate generously to support our programmes and services, including pre-school outreach, that seek to protect and nurture children and youth of all races and religions❤️. 

Visit bit.ly/chiday2020.

description:
Walk for Our Children 2020 (Virtual Edition) is OFFICIALLY LAUNCHED! We are happy and excited as this is our first virtual event! Please participate and help us reach our target of 20 million steps! We are also honoured to have President Halimah Yacob as our Guest of Honour for this event 😊
⁣
It costs only $25 to register and all proceeds will go towards supporting programmes we run to help children, youth and families in need. Visit www.walkforourchildren.sg to register and start clocking the steps 👣 (minimum 5,000 steps/participant in one day). ⁣
⁣
Tag us on Facebook and Instagram (@sgchildrensoc) when you upload photos and videos of your Walk so that we can be updated of your participation! SEE YOU VIRTUALLY! ⁣
⁣
#walkforourchildren2020 #woc2020 #charitywalk #walkforacause #walkathon #fundraising

description:
Giving persons with depression a safe space to share their thoughts is one way of supporting them. Non-verbal cues can also play an important role in our conversations.

Produced by the students from Ngee Ann Polytechnic's Diploma of Psychology Studies, in collaboration with @thepsychpractice, this video shares tips on how to encourage open conversations with persons with depression.

#mentalhealth #mentalhealthawareness #depressionawareness #depressionhelp #depressionsupport

description:
“Are you okay?” “Is everything alright?” “Is it because of assignments again?”

Overwhelming persons with anxiety disorder with questions may not be the best way to support them.

Produced by the students from Ngee Ann Polytechnic's Diploma of Psychology Studies, in collaboration with @thepsychpractice, this video shares the Dos and Don’ts on how best to support persons with anxiety disorder.

#mentalhealth #mentalhealthawareness #anxiety #generalizedanxietydisorder #anxietysupport #anxietyhelp

description:
We had previously developed a guide to help children recognise their body warning signs when they feel unsafe. To access this guide, please click here: bit.ly/kidsguidestaysafe

The guide now takes a more interactive form with #SafeSimon. Safe Simon says that it is important for children to know and listen to their body warning signs when they feel unsafe. Our children should grow up safe and happy.

➡️ Share this video with a child and see if they can follow what Safe Simon says.

What is the #SafeSimonSays message you would like to share with a child today? Tell us more 👇

#SGUnited

description:
Singapore Children’s Society is part of the Safe Circle, a collaboration across seven agencies that focuses on community based mental health services for children and youth.

In support of World Mental Health Day 2020, we are pleased to present to you a 1-hour introductory talk that will explore an understanding of trauma, what is trauma-informed care, its principles, and how we can harness trauma-informed practices to support and build resilience in our children and youth who have been through adverse childhood experiences.

Click here to register for one of the seven sessions now: bit.ly/safecircletic

#traumainformed #traumainformedcare #mentalhealth #worldmentalhealthday #worldmentalhealthday2020

description:
How do we talk to our children about sexual abuse? Even though we recognise the need to protect them, we are often unsure how to begin teaching them about unwanted touches and inappropriate actions.

Hear from Ms Lin Xiaoling, Deputy Director of the Advocacy & Research Department, Singapore Children’s Society, on how parents and caregivers can use storytelling to teach children body safety skills.

She will be conducting an online session to introduce ‘Jun and the Octopus’, a children’s storybook produced by Children’s Society which can be used to kickstart meaningful conversations about body safety on Saturday, 12 September from 2pm to 3 pm. Find out more and register at bit.ly/nlbpt

#bodysafety #childsexualabuse
labels_str: advertisement poster flyer brochure paper person human

description:
Issue 9 of Research Bites is now available online!

In our previous posts, we shared our Lessons from Evaluating the Choo Choo Train Programme, and sought to answer What is the Role of Fathers in Developing Children’s Social Skills.

In an age where digital technology is made necessary, children may unintentionally come across sexual images online. How can parents protect children from online sexual images? Our final feature from this issue explores the effectiveness of strategies parents take to protect their children from sexually explicit online materials. We also provide suggestions on how to communicate with children about their bodies and sexual health.

➡️ Read more about what research says about this: bit.ly/RBJUL2020_3 
➡️ Subscribe to future issues of Research Bites: bit.ly/SUBSCRIBERB
labels_str: advertisement flyer brochure poster paper person human

description:
COVID-19 is not stopping us from holding our annual Walk for Our Children, and so we’re going VIRTUAL 🌎 this year! Happening from 1 October 2020, the virtual event will last 2 months! You can find out more about Walk for Our Children (Virtual Edition) by clicking on the link in our bio! 

Registration opens on 1 October, so watch this space for more event updates! #walkforourchildren2020 #charityevent #fundraising 

All funds raised will go towards supporting the programmes and services that we run across our 12 service centres islandwide. 

PS: We will be having an online contest on Facebook really soon so #staytuned
labels_str: person human female purple teen

description:
Issue 9 of Research Bites is now available online!

During our 13th Singapore Children’s Society Lecture that was held last year, the late Dr John M. Elliott shared research findings about the role of mothers in children’s development. Some of our audience were interested to know more about the role of fathers. This article highlights the importance of secure attachment in child development, and provides tips on how fathers can help to develop their child’s social skills.

➡️ Read more on the role of fathers in developing children’s social skills: bit.ly/RBJUL2020_2
➡️ Subscribe to future issues of Research Bites: bit.ly/SUBSCRIBERB
labels_str: bird animal

description:
Issue 9 of Research Bites is now available online!

In this issue, one of our articles focuses on the lessons from evaluating the Choo Choo Train Programme, which is a programme that teaches moral values to pre-school children using stories and activities. We share some insights on how we determine if our programmes are effective, specifically discussing the steps that we have taken to refine the measures we used to evaluate the Choo Choo Train programme.

➡️ Read more on our takeaways from this evaluation journey: bit.ly/RBJul2020_CCT 
➡️ Subscribe to future issues of Research Bites: bit.ly/SUBSCRIBERB
labels_str: id cards text document person human

description:
Close to 50 volunteers spent their Saturday morning learning about the fundamentals of personal data protection and how it impacts us in the social service sector. Titled ‘Data Protection Awareness for Social Services Volunteers’, the training session was conducted pro-bono by Mr Yuri See, Founder and CEO of Region Management Pte Ltd on 15 August.

The session ended with a Question & Answer segment moderated by Mr Fang Xinwei, who is part of the Volunteer Management team. He was joined by Children’s Society’s Data Protection Officer Ms Joy Lim and Deputy Data Protection Officer Ms Vivyan Chee as panellists. This online session is part of a series organised by the Volunteer Management team to connect and engage with our volunteers.

This online session is part of a series organised by the Volunteer Management team to connect and engage with our volunteers.

description:
Anger is an emotion that everyone experiences. However, coping with anger can be challenging for some children, leading to behavioural outbursts or disruptive behaviours. Moreover, the many changes caused by the ongoing pandemic may pose greater challenges for children to cope with their emotions.

It is important that children learn and find ways to manage these strong and intense feelings. It will also help them to develop healthy relationships.

Join us in our Storm Riders programme to find out how our children can manage their emotions in a safe and healthy manner.

✍ Sign up now at bit.ly/StormRiders2020. Do also share this post with others whom you think may benefit from it!

#angermanagement #copingwithemotions #sgchildrensociety

description:
Our heartiest congratulations to our Chairman Mr Koh Choon Hui for being conferred the Distinguished Service Order for this year's National Day Award! Mr Koh, a stalwart of the social service sector for over four decades, had not only expanded Children’s Society’s reach but also nurtured many social service agencies.

As the Chairman of Singapore Children’s Society since 1978, Mr Koh has led Children’s Society to pioneer many new programmes and services to help bring relief and happiness to children, youth and families in need. On behalf of all our beneficiaries, thank you Mr Koh, for your contribution!

description:

Happy Birthday Singapore 🎂!

description:
📣 We're happy to announce that Jun and the Octopus has been shortlisted as a finalist in the Best Picture Book category of the Singapore Book Awards 2020!

In 2019, we launched Jun and the Octopus, a children's storybook about body safety and sexual abuse prevention. We believe that storybooks serve as a gentle but powerful conversation starter and also they create a safe distance for children to learn about difficult topics.
 
Look out for the next post where the author himself, Mr Goh Eck Kheng shares more on the book creation process! More details to come for the 📽 Singapore Book Awards 2020 Virtual Live Show that will take place on 13 August 2020 at 4pm.

description:
Over 50 volunteers came together to listen to our colleagues from the Children Outreach @ Children’s Society speak about how they could learn to connect with children and engage their caregivers two Saturdays ago. Senior Counsellor Ms Serene Jit Kaur and Counsellor Ms Sharon Eng were the trainers for our second online volunteer training session for the year titled ‘How to Connect with Children and Caregivers’. The volunteers learned that they should pay attention to the child’s mood and behaviour, and be present when engaging with the child. They were also taught strategies to manage parents or caregivers.

The session ended with a Question & Answer segment moderated by Mr Fang Xinwei, who is part of the Volunteer Management team. He was joined by Ms Joy Lim, Director of Children Outreach @ Children’s Society as a panellist. This online session is part of a series organised by the Volunteer Management team to connect and engage with our volunteers.

description:
Apart from inviting youth members from our four youth drop-in centres to share with us their strengths and why they are proud of it, the campaign #CelebrateOurYouth also serves as a platform for our youth members to have their voices heard. 

So, a big THANK YOU to all who have joined us for our Facebook Live last evening! Our youth members Qalishya and Xin Yi shared their experience at @vox.44cc and what inspired them to pursue the path of being a social worker. We also hope that the virtual tour of @vox.44cc gave you a good look into how our youth drop-in centres facilitate interaction and conversations with our youth members!

description:

However, this is not stopping us from using our fitness to do good for our community! 💪🏻💪🏻 
 
#MakeItCountForMore is an online campaign that allows YOU to raise funds through fitness, and help support our youth centres that are reopening – all in the safety of your own home 🏡 

Click on the link in our bio for more instructions to get started! Can’t participate? You can just donate to support our youth centres too! 

#SGUnited #SGTogether #StrongerTogether #socialgood

description:
💻 Our volunteers spent a fruitful morning with our colleague Mr Taha Mattar, who is a Senior Social Worker at VOX @ Children’s Society, in our first online volunteer training session for the year titled ‘Engaging Youth for Positive Change’ last Saturday. Taha was joined by over 60 volunteers who logged in to listen to why the youth tend to do the things they do and shared his experience working with them. 💬 The session ended with a Question & Answer segment moderated by Mr Fang Xinwei, who is part of the Volunteer Management team. He was joined by Ms Rachel Tan, Group Lead of Youth Development Group as a panellist.

This online session is part of a series organised by the Volunteer Management team to connect and engage with our volunteers.

description:
There’s always sunshine after the rain ☀️ With the gradual easing of restrictions when the #COVID19 #circuitbreaker period ends next Monday nationwide, many of us will be eager to resume our lives to before COVID-19.

Even though it will take some time, we can always hope for better days ahead. What is your hope after COVID-19? Share with us in the comment section below ⬇️ #hopebeyondCOVID19 #sgchildrensociety #SGUnited #SGTogether #positivevibes #postcovid19 #postcircuitbreaker #gettingbacktonormal
